intro: Luetkea sibbaldioides, commonly known as the sibbaldian buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Luetkea sibbaldioides is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in wetland habitats.
